TopicTitle: Is there a way of finding out which of my mods has a memory leak?

Articles.Content: I know I could binary sort my mods and note when I suffer a memory leak but I was wondering if there was a known way to see the amount of memory each mod is using to shortcut the process?

Sadly no, a binary search is the fastest way. However any mod that doesn't have any code (no .dll) won't cause a memory leak that isn't in the stock game, so you can find all mods that don't come with a plugin .dll and exclude those at the start.

Well it was worth a try. I`ll swap out half my mods, then half of the ones with the worst memory leak and so forth for half a day in the near future then.

Thanks.
